stories.text:
I recently discovered "FiraCode Nerd Font" and I've been using it everywhere as I setup a fresh new laptop.

Which programming font you currently swear to? I'm always interested in knowing cool fonts to use in my IDEs and terminals.
stories.title: Ask HN: What's your current favorite programming font?

stories.text: I often get to a website and I'm looking for background info on whether it's trustworthy, who's behind it, etc. I'd often just like to post a question to other users of the site, or a warning. It seems like there should be a forum (or even a Better Business Bureau type thing) for the discussion of individual websites, and maybe a browser extension to enable interaction with the "forum page" when you go to the website. I guess this is related to web annotation and curation which I guess are areas of stalled progress. Anyway, does something like this exist?
stories.title: Ask HN: Where do you go for disucssion about a particular domain?
Hashcash: The proof-of-work algorithm for avoiding DoS attacks
